content: Hey all! :wave: We’re spinning up a project group for a standard portable SIMD API that might interest some of you here: https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2977
interested in this as well :smile:

Hey all! We're going to run our first meeting for std::simd over in the #project-portable-simd stream in just under an hour. It might be interesting to folks here. One of the first questions is _where do we put this?_ and any input you have on whether that should or shouldn't be in rust-lang/corearch would be great!

This would be a new repo, separate from packed_simd, importing code from packed_simd on a case-by-case basis. Importantly, we wouldn't likely be using the Simd<[T;N]> type, just specific instanciations such as f32x4 and i16x8 and so on.
We also don’t want to churn packed_simd or end up maintaining two codebases in the one repo
